For almost two years I have worked in a school system where our safety (staff and students) has always been the top priority. I am so thankful for every administrator in Russellville City Schools! Our prayer is that a little time apart saves a lot of lives and keeps us all well.

We are SO PROUD of our school system and so proud to have a superintendent like Heath Grimes who is a very visible and vocal advocate for not only our school system but others as well.
Mr. Grimes is leading the way in our state in changing the narrative for English Language Learners (ELL) and the systems and schools that are going above and beyond to make sure this student population is well-served while still providing a top-notch education to non-ELL students.
We appreciate his leadership and we also very much appreciate the leadership and support from State Representative Jamie Kiel, who is sponsoring a bill in the House that will help systems like RCS that have a high percentage of ELL students.
Working together, we can make a difference and make sure ALL our students receive the best education possible and ALL our systems and schools are fairly evaluated and graded.
Thanks to The TimesDaily for shedding light on this issue for readers in Northwest Alabama.

#MakeADifference #NoMatterWhat
